EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter used for extraction located at (–3.5, 27.5) with its drop position at (–3.5, 28.5).
This unit is repeatedly used as the source interface for multi‐segment belt connections.

### Copper Cable Factory at approximately (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– An input chest (wooden-chest) at (2.5, 17.5) serving as the factory interface.
– A dedicated burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT.
– An auxiliary burner inserter at (1.5, 17.5) (noted with coal fuel) that assists in item transfer.
– A secondary burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5) using direction UP.
– An assembling machine (assembling-machine-1) at (1.5, 19.5) to process materials.
This structure is designed to receive extracted copper plates and manufacture copper cable.

### Belt Depot Network at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) acting as an isolated belt depot.
– A transport belt segment positioned at (4.5, 15.5) adjacent to the depot chest.
– A dedicated depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP.
This network is used as an intermediary routing target for the extraction system’s output.

### Electricity Generator at position (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) at (–0.5, 24.5).
– A boiler at (–5.5, 24.0).
– An offshore pump at (–7.5, 25.5).
This structure is meant to supply power to connected systems, although its connections (via belts and pipes) are subject to placement and target‐type constraints.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• When connecting transport belts:
 – Avoid attempting to directly link a transport belt to a Prototype.SteamEngine target.
  Ensure an intermediary inserter is placed to input items into the steam engine before making the connection.

• When placing entities:
 – If a placement error indicates the target is too far (e.g. wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) with a distance of 15.89 when the max allowed is 10), move the player closer to the intended position before placement.
 – Verify that the required item is present in the inventory prior to placement to avoid shortages.

• When referencing target variables:
 – A NameError (e.g. “target_chest” not defined) suggests that variable naming is inconsistent.
  Double-check that all target variables are properly defined and used in subsequent operations.
